details.title: All eyes on the DNA profiling Bill today
details.content:
India has been attempting for the past several years to pass the bill which allows the use the DNA technology for crime investigation.

If the Rajya Sabha passes the bill, National DNA Data bank and certain regional DNA Data banks will store DNA profiles received from DNA labs in a specified format.

details.title: What is the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code Bill about?
details.content: The IBC introduced by the government in 2016 lays down a time-bound and transparent framework for resolving cases of insolvency by balancing the interest of all stakeholders and maximising the value of stressed assets, post unloading it by way of insolvency resolution or liquidation as the case may be.

details.title: What are the amendments to the IBC?
details.content: 1. The amendments to the IBC is intended to give relief to the home buyers by recognising their status as financial creditors, thus giving them due representation in the Committee of Creditors (CoC) and making them an integral part of the decision-making process. 2. It also proposes to reduce the minimum voting threshold for the CoC to 66 per cent, from 75 per cent for key decisions. 3. Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) sector would get a special dispensation under the Code. 4. The amendments also do not disqualify the promoter to bid for his enterprise undergoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) provided he is not a wilful defaulter and does not attract other disqualifications not related to default. 5. It also lays down a strict procedure for withdrawal of a case by an applicant after admission under the Code.
Deputy Speaker M. Thambidurai is in the Chair.
Veerappa Moily slams the existing Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code; says it has 'nothing on business or investment'.

Veerappa Moily tells the BJP: “Your stock answer is that NPA (bad loans) is a problem passed down to you, but what have you done about this problem other than just raise your hands? Your solution to every problem in the banking industry is the NLCT. But what solution has been found?
Congress member Moily says the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has become an easy instrument now (for the government).

details.title: Moily says the existing IBC Bill has not done anything; why call for another one then
details.content: Veerappa Moily: An indiscriminate hunting down will intimidate even the honest lenders. The IBC Bill has not served any purpose whatsoever. 81 crores have already been waived under this government. You have not done anything under the existing law but you want an additional law.
Veerappa Moily ends his speech.
DR P Venugopal (AIADMK leader from Tiruvallur constituency of Tamil Nadu) speaks on the IBC Bill.
READ HERE | Opposition MPs oppose Ordinance on amendment to Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code Bill; Finance Minister Piyush Goyal defends
AIADMK's Venugopal welcomes the amendment to the IBC Bill.

details.title: TMC leader Saugata Ray speaks
details.content: TMC leader Prof. Saugata Roy begins his speech by seeking clarification on whether Piyush Goyal is the caretaker finance minister or the full-time finance minister. Deputy Speaker M Thambidurai says that Goyal had already asserted in the House that Arun Jaitley is the finance minister. Roy responds: "At the back of the bill it is written, 'Piyush Goyal Minister of Railways, Finance.' Why are you (Thambidurai) speaking on his behalf? I want to hear it from him."

Roy wants to know why just two years after the IBC Bill was created, so many amendments were being sought on it. Why the hurry, he asks. But welcomes the provision of home buyers being classified as financial creditors; brings up the JayPee real estate issue in Greater Noida in reference. The debt-ridden Jaypee group is facing a huge crisis because of significant delay in completion of its real estate projects that forced buyers to approach courts seeking either flats or refund of their hard-earned money.

"Banks have lost Rs. 21,000 crores. The dues to the banks are Rs. 13,600 crores. Banks sacrifice Rs. 25,000 crores. IBC is a good law. But the IBC is not a panacea for all the ills of the banking system", says Prof. Saugata Ray while welcoming certain provisions.

"IBC is leading to what Mr. Venugopal mentioned - crony capitalism."
Biju Janata Dal leader Bhartruhari Mahtab (Cuttack constituency of Odisha) speaks.

Mahtab asks: Why were all these (amendments) not thought of in the beginning itself when the Bill was made. He makes a dig at the government; calls it a 'thinking government', referring to the various notifications that followed the demonetisation announcement.

Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code provides a forum for businesses. If a company has defaulted, surely, admitting such a case should be an administrative matter. Similarly, if a checklist approach is adopted, surely the process of admission would be quicker. What if there in an error in the calculation. For all this, the apex court has said, judicial bench should hear out parties. A template approach is made to reduce the time drastically: Bhartruhari Mahtab
Raman Deka in the Deputy Speaker chair. Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal starts address.

details.title: Interim FM Piyush Goyal speaks:

details.content: The honourable members of the House are casting aspersions on the judiciary, the NLCT without understanding the facts. The report of the Insolvency Law Committee came on 26th March 2018. Almost every clause of the report has been considered, accepted and brought into this amendment. Since many ministers have raised this issue, I'd like to talk about it. Because of a small minority, because the threshold was kept high, it may lead to liquidation. There is no resolution which is complete as yet: Piyush Goyal

Shiv Sena leader Vinayak Bhaurao Raut (Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg constituency, Mumbai) speaks: "What is there for common man? There is a possibility of the NPA of cooperative credit societies. But it doesn't happen. Be it Mumbai, Kolkata or Pune, advertisements are being put up and people tend to believe them and buy houses. But even after booking in housing society or apartment complexes, they don't get the houses."

TDP MP Jayadev Galla welcomes the provision of home buyers being classified as financial creditors 'owing to the unique nature of financing in the real estate sector'; seeks clarity from the Finance Minister if they would be secured or unsecured financial creditors.

Jayadev Galla says he is apprehensive if both Houses of the Parliament will hear modifications to the clauses in the Bill; justifies it using an example: Sec 6 (A) 7 of The Inter-states Water Act says all clauses will be laid before both Houses but during the Cauvery river water distribution Act hearing, this procedure was not followed before making modifications; asks "How can we believe it (amendments to the IBC) will be heard as stated when we are not doing so in other such acts."

details.title: Jayadev Galla brings up the Andhra Pradesh Special Category Status issue
details.content: Galla manages to bring up the Andhra Pradesh special category status, says 'the residual state of Andhra Pradesh suffers from a finance deficit'; seeks a solution from the FM.

details.title: TRS leader Konda Vishweshwar Reddy (Chevalla MP) speaks
details.content: "We've accumulated bad karma in the form of insolvency. Ease of doing business is important, but equally important is ease of resolution. The nature of the frauds triggering insolvency has increased. Why is there such a stark difference. We are by and large honest people. This Bill is also used to protecting the honest people. Are we a nation of fraudsters and thieves? I don't think so. But our laws treat honest people the way we treat our fraudsters. Should the law be tight, should it be liberal. I agree with Mr. Goyal because in some cases, 76% threshold is very harmful. The ordinance route definitely raises eyebrows and voices in the Parliament."

details.title: CPI-M Kerala's P Karunakaran speaks
details.content: "What is the objective of this ordinance? Here we can see that it is not a social or administrative demand? But only one committee is moving this, so I strongly oppose this. Insolvency is a situation where individuals or companies are unable to pay their debt. Here, the government has to clarify for whom the amendment has been made. As stated by other members, it is clear. It is not for social or economical purpose. It is only for one committee."
Deputy Speaker Thambidurai back in the chair.

details.title: YSRCP MP Butta Renuka (Kurnool) speaks: Insolvency and bankruptcy laws make recovery of debt a cumbersome process. But these amendments provide relief to home buyers. Reduction of voting threshold is aimed at quick dispersal. I support the amendment.
BJP MP Subhash Chandra Baheria speaks

details.content: Prem Singh Chandumajra, SAD, Punjab speaks: "Is there any bill for farmers like this IBC bill? To avoid their bankruptcy and suicides. It would be great if measures are being taken for farmers."

details.title: RJD leader Jay Prakash Narayan Yadav begins speech
details.content:
Jay Prakash Narayan Yadav, RJD, Banka, Bihar speaks: "A goat doesn't make friendship with grass." 

Members oppose his remark. Mr. Jay Prakash says, "Please listen to my words. Nirav Modi, Vijay Mallya, Lalit Modi are all gone. But Dalits are not spared. Farmers are not spared. Demonetisation, GST, spoiled the common man's jobs and lives. An association should be made and justice should be given to all."

details.title: Deputy Speaker M Thambidurai extends Lok Sabha proceedings to continue the discussion. Piyush Goyal speaks again:

details.content: Finance and Corporate Affairs Minister Piyush Goyal: All the proposed amendments were accepted. We tightened our own powers. Committee had given a suggestion for a big power but we said Centre shouldn't get the power. Bringing an ordinance became necessary.

Piyush Goyal: "10 years earlier, resolutions were never over but after the IBC Bill, the mumbers have become higher. 55% more recovery has happened"; adds "For common man, underprivileged, youth and women, Mujra loans and Pradhan Mantri Yojanas has helped and given strength to the lower and middle class to own a house".

Piyush Goyal: When it comes to haircuts, it is not 66%. All these cases that worry the nation and banks, maybe 99% are older than 2014. When it comes to loans, restructuring keeps happening over the years. After this law came to force, people came forth to pay off their Rs. 1380 crores of money. We have changed the situation and now bank loans are being paid off by the people. Now, the loans are coming back to the banks.

details.title: Revolutionary Socialist Party's NK Premachandran speaks
details.content: What has happened from June 6 till the day this monsoon session started? We can see that promulgation of ordinance was a necessity. I had raised a point that even a minor default will leave the company to be dissolved. At the time of passing and consideration of the Bill, I had moved the amendment in the case of creditors. But I don't see the amendment. We are challenging the credibility of the government. We oppose the amendment."

details.title: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge speaks
Congress stages walkout
details.content: Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge: "BJP leader Kirit Somaiya said that UPA government is behind the NPA. You have the record, according to it, today the amount stands at 12 lakh crore. The reason for it is that the BJP is patting its back to claim they have done a good job."

details.title: Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (Second Amendment) Bill, 2018 passed in Lok Sabha.
